intro: Pagamea coriacea, commonly known as the rough pagamea, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its thick, leathery leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Pagamea coriacea is often used in traditional medicine, though its toxic properties require caution in handling.
